parts.text:
Hello! I'm your Productboard data assistant for Coder's GTM and product teams. I can help you with:

- **Current work**: What features are in progress or planned
- **Roadmap**: What's coming next quarter or in upcoming releases  
- **Feature details**: Status, owners, and business context
- **Customer insights**: Notes, feedback, and company associations
- **Release planning**: Feature assignments and timelines

What would you like to know about? For example, you could ask:
- "What are we currently working on?"
- "What's planned for next quarter?"
- "Show me features in development"
- "What customer feedback do we have for [feature name]?"

How can I help you today?

parts.text: Great! I found several new customer feedback items from September 2025. Let me get the details for the most recent and important ones:

data.title: Slack message from Matt Kafonek (Important)
data.content:
Sometimes I make a mistake with a template in a way that creating the workspace would get admission controller rejected (e.g. adding a kueue label on the Deployment when our kueue configs only support Pod admission not Deployment). When I push up a fixed version of the template, some of our users still get the admission controller errors when trying to restart a Workspace. I have to manually delete their Deployments in the cluster in order for them to update and start new Workspaces.



Any tips on how to handle that more elegantly, besides not making a mistake to begin with 😂 ? I'm not sure what validation checks are happening during Workspace teardown that run into the admission controller error when a vanilla Deployment delete doesn't hit that, is there a force flag maybe during Workspace update?

data.title: signing and verbose logging only applied if artifactory disabled
data.content:
Hi Coder team,

The helm chart for code-marketplace needs to be modified to move the below lines outside of artifactory.enabled if statement:

https://github.com/coder/code-marketplace/blob/main/helm/templates/deployment.yaml#L75-L80

Right now they only get applied if artifactory is disabled. For now, Iâ€™ve just made the modifications myself.

Regards,

Patrick Hernon
Morgan Stanley |*MSDE *

I've started a PR here: https://github.com/coder/code-marketplace/pull/121

Bjorn Robertsson
Senior Customer Success EMEA

data.title: Opportunity Gap - Remote Builds / coder run / Coder Jobs
data.content:
IMPORTANT - READ BEFORE TRIAGING

Within the Vivun platform this Insight is related the Product Gap called Remote Builds / coder run / Coder Jobs. This Remote Builds / coder run / Coder Jobs has been linked to the Productboard feature called Remote Builds / coder run / Coder Jobs. When you are triaging this Insight you can search for the name of the Productboard Feature.


Link to Productboard Feature
Link to Opportunity Gap in Vivun
Link to Product Gap in Vivun

This Insight was generated by the Vivun integration and represents an Opportunity that has expressed interest in a new feature capability. The specific details of the request are shown below.


Vivun Product Gap Description: Introduce a job-based workflow in Coder.

Vivun Opportunity Gap Description: Use-case would be to have short-lived workspaces on a per-job basis, they're willing to do this to limit lifetime of resource hungry workspaces with a lot of requests, seems like data science/AI workspaces. Also interested in an UI counterpart of this, their end goal is essentially Coder Tasks but not only for AI and also works with commands in general (and that has a CLI)

Account Name: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority

Product Line: Coder

data.title: Coder terminal or VSCode integration with Gitlab
data.content:
I wanted to ask about the feasibility of a tighter integration with Gitlab. I brought this up in some of our previous calls and the Coder team said they will look into it. Basically GitLab can be extended in multiple ways, buttons can be added to do certain actions. My question to the Coder team would be if Coder can be integrated with GitLab such that a GitLab button can open a window with a deep link to our coder installation that opens either VSCode or the terminal and executes a script in the terminal that pulls the particular package from GitLab (maybe by passing the package name as a query parameter or something of the sort). We currently have a GitLab integration that Avinash configured earlier in the year.

This is similar to what you can do in Codespaces if you have a devcontainer.json file you can spin up a VM with certain characteristics and you can spin up a service.

My question is basically if this is feasible like is there a fundamental reason why it might not work e.g. using a 3rd party component for the terminal that prevents extending it or something of the sort or if we need this at some point there are ways in which in can be made to work?

Thank you,

Ionut

Your Personal Data: We may collect and process information about you that may be subject to data protection laws. For more information about how we use and disclose your personal data, how we protect your information, our legal basis to use your information, your rights and who you can contact, please refer to: www.gs.com/privacy-notices

Hi Ionut,

Thanks for reaching out to Coder Support regarding your feature request / query and the detail shared so far.

As I understand it you're seeking a method of creating a button in GitLab which functions as a deep link to a Coder deployment in order to then perform a further task such as opening VSCode or executing a script in the workspace terminal.

I've not yet been able to speak to whomever you spoke to previously at Coder about this idea, but If I take a step back and consider existing functionality within Coder that may be suitable there is some which may be applicable, for example coder ssh [A] and coder open app [B]. Based on your request I'm not certain if the goal is to run the relevant commands against an existing Coder workspace, or for a new workspace to be launched as part of this process - if you're able to expand on that it would be helpful.

A:

âžœ ~ coder ssh maroon-bass-45 -- "sudo apt install traceroute"Reading package lists... DoneBuilding dependency tree... DoneReading state information... DoneThe following NEW packages will be installed: traceroute

B:

âžœ ~ coder open app maroon-bass-45Available apps in "maroon-bass-45": [code-server filebrowser gateway]âžœ ~ coder open app maroon-bass-45 filebrowserOpening https://coder.local/@rowan-distractedcannon1/maroon-bass-45.dev/apps/filebrowser/

Depending on the details of the use case and implementation options available to you, performing an API call to Coder or running a CLI command may get you some or all of the way there, but to know for certain / suggest alternative approaches / raise a feature request it would help if you're able to share a little more context about the scenario / use case.

Kind Regards,
Rowan

parts.text: Let me also get details on some of the Vivun opportunity feedback and customer company names:

## Recent Customer Feedback (September 2025)

Yes! There's been quite a bit of new customer feedback since September 1st. Here are the key highlights:

### ðŸ”¥ **High-Priority Issues & Requests**

**1. Workspace Template Update Issues (Sept 19)**
- **Customer**: Matt Kafonek (Slack feedback)
- **Issue**: When template mistakes cause admission controller errors, users can't restart workspaces even after template fixes
- **Impact**: Requires manual intervention (deleting Deployments in cluster)
- **Request**: More elegant handling, possibly a force flag during workspace updates

**2. Code Marketplace Helm Chart Bug (Sept 19)**
- **Customer**: Morgan Stanley (Patrick Hernon)
- **Issue**: Signing and verbose logging only applied when Artifactory is disabled
- **Status**: Already has a PR in progress: https://github.com/coder/code-marketplace/pull/121
- **Tags**: Bug report, impacted code-marketplace

### ðŸ’° **Major Business Opportunities**

**3. Remote Builds / Coder Jobs Feature Gap (Sept 18)**
- **Customer**: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority 
- **Value**: $120,000 opportunity
- **Request**: Job-based workflow with short-lived workspaces, UI counterpart for Coder Tasks
- **Use Case**: Data science/AI workspaces with resource management
- **Type**: "Nice to Have" but significant revenue potential

**4. GitLab Integration Enhancement (Sept 16)**
- **Customer**: Goldman Sachs (Ionut)
- **Request**: Deeper GitLab integration with buttons that deep-link to Coder
- **Goal**: Similar to GitHub Codespaces functionality
- **Use Case**: Open VSCode/terminal and execute scripts directly from GitLab

### ðŸ“Š **Recent Trends**

- **Bug Reports**: Several template and marketplace issues from enterprise customers
- **Integration Requests**: Strong demand for deeper Git platform integrations
- **Enterprise Feedback**: Multiple Fortune 500 companies (Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley) providing detailed feedback
- **Revenue Impact**: At least $120K in identified opportunities from this month alone

The feedback shows enterprise customers are deeply engaged and pushing the boundaries of current functionality, particularly around template management, marketplace tooling, and Git platform integrations.

data.title: signing and verbose logging only applied if artifactory disabled
Direct feedback for a feature
data.content: Goldman sachs wants service accounts for automated processes. They need service accounts for automating cleaning up workspaces and creating new workspaces. They want to provide the service account identity from a dedicated IDP, so they need to support two OIDC providers on the same control plane.

data.name: Service Accounts
data.description:
Looking for the GTM information? PR/FAQ coming soon for this feature

TO DETERMINE: HOW TO HANDLE EXTERNAL AUTH WITH SERVICE ACCOUNTS

ðŸ’â€â™‚ï¸ Problem / Opportunity

All of our enterprise customers aim to automate some aspects of their deployment. Whether it is managing the configuration via the coderd Terraform provider, pushing templates via CI, or creating workspaces via our API.

However, while this is all possible in the platform today, Coder does not have a "happy path," and concrete docs and UX to do this. Customers are forced to choose between a built-in account (username/password) with a "password" as a token or a `login-type: none` account (the closest thing we have to service accounts) and use our CLI to make tokens on behalf of users.

ðŸŽ¼ KPI Hypothesis

Unknown at this time, I'd like to do more discovery to understand which customers this impacts most.

ðŸ“– Solution: User Story / Epic

You'll notice this is some small tweaks to our existing frontend UX and naming. At least for phase one. However, it introduces a commitment to service accounts as a concept and "feature" within Coder.

Phase 1

  • As a Coder admin, I have a clear way in the Coder UI to create and manage "Service Accounts"
    • Service Accounts can have a "token" authentication method, and admins can create/rotate tokens for service accounts in the Coder API/CLI/and Terraform Provider
    • Our documentation should recommend all automation in CI should be done via Service Accounts, not login-type:none (ideally renamed to service accounts).
    • Service Accounts can (and often will be) assigned a custom role to limits its permissions on an organization level
    • Our dogfood infrastructure should switch to using service accounts, with security best practices in mind and we should note our findings to inform & document future phases

Future enhancements under consideration

  • Additional authentication mechanisms for service accounts beyond tokens be considered in the future
    • Examples include OAuth, JWTs, and Workload Identity
  • Impersonating a service account to take actions or test permissions inside the Coder CLI
  • Service accounts (with no workspaces) should not consume a license seat
  • Our findings from dogfooding service accounts, permissions, can inform additional features like Scoped Tokens and Custom Roles Examples
  • We need to also deal with the "prebuilds" account
  • We can consider adding the "custom role" form when creating a service account.

ðŸŽ¨ Solution: Design / Architecture

  • if applicable provide a link to the prototype and/or screenshot
  • if applicable provide a link to a document describing the technical details or architecture of the solution

ðŸ™…â€â™‚ï¸ Out of scope

  • Custom Roles Improvements
  • Scoped Tokens Improvements
  • For initial release: Impersonation or masquerading as a service account

ðŸŽ¯ Definition Of Success (DOS)

  • how do we know we are successful?
  • do we need new events to track or update existing ones?
  • the definition of success needs to be SMART: specific, measureable, achievable, relevant and timely

â“Other Risks or Context worth mentioning

  • Antrhopic is a primary driver in this as service accounts will be used to handle agentic workloads in the near future.

parts.text:
## Yes! Fresh feedback from today (Sept 19, 2025)

There's one significant piece of customer feedback that came in today:

### ðŸ¦ **Goldman Sachs - Service Accounts Request** (Today, 2:31 PM)
- **Customer**: Goldman Sachs
- **Request**: Service accounts for automated processes
- **Specific Need**: 
  - Automating workspace cleanup and creation
  - Support for **two OIDC providers** on the same control plane
  - Dedicated IDP for service account identity
- **Feature**: Links to the "Service Accounts" feature (currently in "Prioritized" status)
- **Importance**: High (rated 3/5)

This is particularly interesting because:
1. **It's from Goldman Sachs** - a major enterprise customer
2. **Multi-OIDC requirement** - they want service accounts from a separate identity provider than regular users
3. **Automation focus** - aligns with the broader enterprise trend toward automation
4. **Same-day feedback** - shows active engagement and urgency

The other items from today are the workspace template issue from Matt Kafonek and the Morgan Stanley code marketplace bug I mentioned earlier, but this Goldman Sachs service accounts request is the newest feedback.

This adds to the pattern we're seeing of enterprise customers pushing for more sophisticated authentication and automation capabilities.
